poem.title: Private Banking
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: What do we want? A forty-watt ruby Big as the wart on this digit. A waft of chanel from that silk When I clasp it. A warped sense of justice To fit what goes on. The genie walked down to the lake (he could walk) Leant on the railing and watched the wee boats. Anything else? he said, over his shoulder.
